text:
Hi all, I wanted to give you an update on the HTML module in the new Design Manager. 

We are getting close to listing modules in the Marketplace. In the next couple weeks we will seed the Marketplace with a dozen or so modules. One of those modules with be the HTML module. We will not be delivering the HTML  module to all portals and instead users who would like to use the HTML module will be able to download it from the Marketplace into their HubSpot portal . 

In addition to the HTML module in the Marketplace we will also be adding an HTML field to the new Modules framework. 

For those of you who are providers in the Marketplace we will be sending you all some information in the coming weeks on submitting modules for listing in the Marketplace. 

If your not a Marketplace provider but it sounds interesting you can create a provider account here - <https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-marketplace-account>
It is also worth noting that the source code button in Rich Text Modules is currently available in page editor for templates built using the new Design Manager.
<@U6Z3FRJ2D> Can you expand on what is broken?
but have you guys fixed the issue where the source code button is not available on the design manager side for design manager v2 custom module rich text fields?
Per <@U8THBCFC4>'s comment,  we are in the process of adding this back to the rich text editor in the new Design Manager.
ahh woops didn't catch that message:+1:
No problem, thanks for keeping us on our toes!

Feature request with new design manager - It would be awesome if rich text fields and image fields in custom modules could be set to be "smart content" 

I wouldn't say it's a crazy high priority but it would make custom modules even more useful and powerful. I realize how dramatically complex that could be to integrate and plan out. Just pointing it out because Smart Content is such a great feature for marketers.

Would think it would be pretty reasonable if you slowly added the functionality, for example, starting with rich text fields that are not in repeaters and whatnot(whatever makes the logic easier for you guys to build)

(will suggest with feedback button too, just figured other people, might have thoughts on this too)

Thanks for the feedback <@U7SL518D6>, much appreciated. We have some stuff cooking around this. I do not have any release dates or plans I can share publicly for this yet but it is absolutely something we are thinking about.
<@U22PNRAJD> <@U7SL518D6> I second this. We would also love this at Bluleadz.

Is there a way with the color picker in the new modules, to be able to have it pull in the primary or secondary accent color from Content Settings as the "Default". I know I could write if/then statements in HubL to set it by default and override it if they pick a new color, but then the HEX code they see in the color picker wouldn't match what the actual default color is. Thoughts?
yes, there is no custom html module on “add module” on website page edit.  <https://cl.ly/p54X>
but, like you can see, there is a custom html module that was there before the new modules. And, because it was native, we can made personalization on it. <https://cl.ly/p62w>
<https://cl.ly/p68o>
you should be able to set that as a variable in the code

and yes, we built our modules to can control a lot of things on our websites. and the “old native custom html” works for us to make context personalization to that modules: hide, displays, backgrounds, animations a tons of things via CSS and javascript :disappointed:

<@U25C65C3S> So I have this in the code to by default use their primary accent color.

background-color: rgba({{ site_settings.primary_accent_color|convert_rgb }}, {{ widget.overlay_opacity }} );

But in the editor if I give them a Color Overlay Choice so that if they want to override their primary accent color (IE: they don't want to affect other items using that color, so they don't want to change it in Content Settings), then they see what ever I have set as the "default color". I want the HEX to show what is being used by default in the code above.

Does that make sense?
<@U26C29XPH> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26C29XPH/F8Y5U17DF/screen_shot_2018-01-25_at_11.06.10_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 11.06.10 AM.png>
hang on i'll dig something up.. (haven't tried it personally yet but it *should* work)
{% color "my_color_picker" label='Choose a color', color= site_settings.primary_accent_color no_wrapper=True %}
other modules can have variables set as the "default". not sure if it will work but it's worth a try <@U26C29XPH>
you could add a boolean, if show default - overlay color field shows, if show default = false dont show overlay color field

Ok <@U25C65C3S> that makes sense. I was trying to take advantage of  using the new modules capability in a "Custom Module" rather than using HubL to generate the Color picker module in the custom module.
ahhh!. might be agood *feature request* cc: <@U22PNRAJD>
Josh try the "copy snippet" on the color field, likely will generate an inline field code similar to how we used hubl supported modules

it does that with text and rich text fields, I'd assume color as well

you would just set value just like Remmington proposed
Ultimately all I wanted was to be able to dynamically set the Default color being shown in the HEX box by pulling from their Content Settings.  I'll see if I can hack it to work lol.
has anyone used a good responsive menu in place of the default HS menu?
:wave: Hi all, we have added the source edit button back into the rich text module in the new Design Manager.
<@U22PNRAJD> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U22PNRAJD/F8Z1E3ME1/screen_shot_2018-01-25_at_5.43.31_pm.png|Screen Shot 2018-01-25 at 5.43.31 PM.png>
Ok. thank you. I have given an update in this channel as the the plans for adding back in the HTML module. We have also just added the source code button back to the rich text modules.
Thanks
